job.title: Quality Associate
job.description:
About Us:

At Mergon, we mould ideas for a sustainable future. We work with leading brands like Tesla, Landrover, Xerox and Abbott to design, manufacture and deliver sustainable products for the vehicles and equipment of the future.

We care deeply about our colleagues, customers and our community and we have a curiosity that constantly pushes us to innovate and improve. We are competent, capable and we invest in our people and in our processes to ensure we continue to grow and do our best work every day.

The Job:

We are currently recruiting a Quality Associate on a 4 cycle shift pattern who will have responsibility for performing quality checks on production and highlighting and resolving non adherence to quality procedures and specifications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Adhere to quality procedures and specifications.
  • Responsibility to monitor production, high-light and resolve non adherence to quality procedures and specifications.
  • Assist in resolving quality related issues in production (screening of product / decision on product), ensuring issues are documented correctly.
  • Carry out product audits.
  • Verify First Piece and in Process.
  • Perform product inspection where required for on hold parts.
  • Carry out production operator training to ensure that operators understand all relevant specification and procedures.

To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • Experience working in a manufacturing environment
  • Experience working in a Quality Assurance role - desired but not essential
  • Excellent attention to detail regarding product specification and maintaining documentation
  • Strong teamwork skills
  • Solution focused
  • Strong communication skills, and the ability to articulate product defects to production and quality team

Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • 26 days holidays
  • Health Insurance for you and your family
  • Career Growth and Development Opportunities
  • Company Gym
  • Wellness Programme
  • Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)

Mergon is an Equal Opportunity Employer that offers flexible working arrangements and values a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Mergon is an Irish owned company with operations in Ireland,  Czech Republic, U.K., Mexico and USA.

Established in 1981 Mergon works with leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors.

It's Irish operations are based in Castlepollard in the heart of the Irish Midlands close to Mullingar. Mergon are an excellent employer in the midlands and have been very supportive of the local community over the years. Mergon have been involved in excellent health and education initiatives such as International Men’s Day, LEGO DAY , Science Week  and Mergon's School Engineering Experience. 

Mergon works with its customers to design, manufacture and assemble components that make their products succeed in their chosen markets.

In recent years the company has increased its capabilities in additive manufacturing and systems manufacturing; supplying complex moulded and electronics based assemblies to major clients like Abbott and Xerox.

As a result of working across many different sectors, Mergon has access to and experience in best practice from leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors. We believe this wealth of cross industrial experience makes us a valuable partner and gives our customers insights to ideas that typical suppliers may not have.

 

As a responsible plastic products manufacturer, Mergon constantly works to ensure that its impact on the environment meets or exceeds the expectations of both customers and the community.

Through the effective implementation of reduction, re-use and re-cycling policies and to underline our pro-active approach, Mergon was the first Technical Blow Molding company in the world to receive accreditation to the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, which provides a framework for cost-effective and environmentally sensitive manufacturing.

job.title: Document & Stock Controller
job.description:
Stock Controller Incorporating Safety Representative Duties

A Stock Controller tracks stock levels and ensures that the supplies of raw materials & finished goods are sufficient to current stands, regulations, and the demand of customers. Your primary duties include checking stock levels, ordering additional stock and updating stock records. The Company Policy is to ensure that stock control is monitored accordingly to ensure maximum quality in a profitable manner in a safe environment.

Stock Controller responsibilities include but not limited to:

 

o   Reporting to Business Development Manager & Production Manager

 

o   Checking Stock levels regularly and communicating with Production Manager/Business Development Manager regularly to ensure adequate supply of all stock both raw materials & finished goods.

o   Updating stock levels and ensuring accurate records are maintained.

 

o   Liaising with other Team Leaders and Management daily to ensure efficient production of priority Stock requirement in line with order schedule.

o   Report to management on issues with finished goods quality or supply.

 

o   Identify issues in efficiency of stock control and suggest improvements & implement where necessary.

 

o   Place orders as required by Production/Management for all Raw Materials required to complete finished product.

o   Preparing and loading off any Courier collections in line with dispatch schedule.

 

Document Controller Duties include but not limited to:

 

o   Reporting to the Production Manger

 

o   Carrying out safety risks assessments daily and directing Production Manager of any hazards.

 

o   Liaising with Production Manager to ensure the Safety Management System is updated daily

 

o   Preparing and filing reports for accidents and other safety breaches & Recording in Company ‘Serious Incident Log Book’.

 

o   Ensuring all Safety equipment including PPE is used accordingly.

o   Ensure all Fire equipment and Exits are inspected on a daily basis

o   Maintain adequate stock of PPE, First Aid kits and tracking distribution of same.

o   Dealing with Minor incidents onsite in line with First Aid safety training received, and alerting Emergency services in the event of serious incident.

 

Other Daily Tasks include but not Limited to:

o   Updating stock accurately on Finished goods board daily and highlighting any discrepancies.

 

o   Co-ordinate with Production Manager/Team Leaders on priority stock requirement for dispatch daily.

o   Spot check finished goods, brand & label accordingly and report any quality issues to production manager.

 

o   Order raw materials as required including raw aggregates, admixtures, cement, steel.

 

o   Maintain, Store and organise deliveries as required.

 

o   Distribute PPE Gear to production staff and record accordingly.

 

o   Perform regular Safety Checks and record daily in line with Company safety Policy.

                

Qualifications:

All training will be provided

job.title: Quality & Health & Safety Engineer
job.description:
Role/ Job Title:                 Quality & HSE Engineer

Reporting to:                    Engineering/ Operations Manager (or as directed)

Location:                            The role will be based out of RDS offices in Mullingar; there may be a requirement for infrequent travel throughout Ireland as per business and customer requirements. 

Department:                     Operations

 

Overview of the Role

The Quality & HSE (Health, Safety & Environmental) Engineer role is crucial to the successful supply of high-quality, bespoke automation equipment to our world leading customers, and to ensuring the safety of all colleagues. This is an exciting opportunity for someone seeking a varied role supporting the quality and compliance requirements of the business.

Quality - Core Duties & Responsibilities

·        Developing and implementing quality standards.

·        Developing and implementing and maintaining ISO 9001 quality control systems.

·        Monitoring and analysing quality performance.

·        Inspecting and testing materials, equipment, processes, and products to ensure quality specifications are met.

·        Collaborating with operations managers to develop and implement controls and improvements.

·        Ensuring that workflows, processes, and products comply with safety regulations.

·        Generates, executes, and reviews, qualification and validation protocols, to conformance to regulations and customer requirements.

·        Reviews, edits and approves change controls, deviations, and corrective actions.

·        Ensure all project documentation deliverables are provided to all stakeholders on time.

·        Research and coordinate the introduction of new processes associated with the role.

·        Liaise and communicate with the different project team members.

·        Responsible for ensuring that timelines and targets are achieved.

·        Lead, manage and oversee internal and external quality audits, and actions arising from same.

HSE (Health, Safety & Environmental) – Core Duties & Responsibilities

·        Manage all EHS aspects on site and on customers sites.

·        Implement the company's health, safety, and environmental policy, procedures and management systems.

·        Advise & assist site management in drafting and communicating method statements, Safe Plans of Action and Toolbox Talks.

·        Provide advice, guidance and instruction in all health & safety matters to management, EHS, safety representatives and employees (including sub-contractors where appropriate).

·        Deliver Health & Safety induction programmes for new employees or sub-contractors working on site.

·        Conduct regular inspections and site audits, reporting findings to site and senior company management. Strict follow-up is required to ensure that actions are dealt with immediately.

·        Ensure that all accidents are reported, recorded and investigated and that suitable notification is given to the Directors, Health & Safety Authority and Insurers as required.

·        Compile EHS reports for senior management and presenting on this report where required.

·        Promote the Company mission of being a healthy and incident and injury free workplace.

·        Involved in the development and delivery of Safety training as required.

·        Liaise with clients, consultants & various regulatory bodies on all EHS aspects for day-to-day operations on site where required.

·        Compile Construction Plans, Safety Statements, RAMS etc.

 

General Duties

 

  • Act courteously and communicate effectively with all those whom you come into contact with during the course of employment including colleagues, customers, suppliers, contractors, visitors.
  • Foster and develop good customer and public relations at all times and portray a professional image of the Company at all times.
  • Report for work in a timely manner and conduct work as scheduled to both Company and customer satisfaction.
  • Work within the instructions and procedures of the Company’s systems as directed by your manager/ other management as appropriate.
  • Conduct all duties in a constructive, productive and efficient manner at all times.
  • Act diligently and professionally in the interest of the Company.
  • Report any personal circumstances affecting/ impacting your ability to legally perform your duties.

 

Note

The above job description is non-exhaustive and is intended to be a general outline of the role, duties and responsibilities of the position. It may be added to in the future, depending on the needs of the business, customers etc.

 

Person Specification

·        2+ years of experience in quality engineering, quality assurance, or a similar role.

·        Knowledge/ experience of health & safety and associated responsibilities, for example, experience of being a Health & Safety Representative

·        Competent in writing documents in a concise and structured format.

·        Ability to comprehend regulatory requirements and technical documentation.

·        Familiar with executing equipment test such as, FAT, and SAT Protocols.

·        Knowledge of automation manufacturing equipment is an advantage.

·        Competent customer-facing communication skills and strong collaboration skills.

·        Ability to prioritise tasks and manage time effectively.

·        Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & MS Project).

job.title: Finance Manager.
job.description:
POSITION TITLE:

·        Finance Manager.

DURATION:

·        1 year maternity leave cover (with possibility of further extension)

DEPARTMENT:

·        Finance Department.

REPORTING TO:

·        The Site Managing Director with a dotted line to the EMEA Group Finance Director.

POSITION OVERVIEW: 

·        The person will be responsible for overseeing and managing all aspects of the site Finance Department.

·        Effective communication with other departments, management, and authorities regarding the financial management of the business.

·        Key contributor to the business that provides overall leadership to the Finance team and foster a diverse, entrepreneurial environment that enables all  participants to contribute to their fullest potential in pursuit of organizational goals and objectives.

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Managing the day-to-day operations of the Finance function, including but not limited to:

·        Lead the monthly financial reporting process in line with group reporting timelines.

·        Take ownership of the monthly reporting packs including detailed variance analysis and commentary on financial performance and business KPIs.

·        Present monthly results to the Group Management and Site Management Teams for review, including analysis on overhead expenditure and adherence to budget or forecast.

·        Treasury management and forecasting.

·        Day to day management of finance team, gaining an excellent understanding of workloads to create efficiencies and standard work.

·        Maintenance of nominal ledger including transaction auditing, journal posting and expense coding.

·        Maintain balance sheet leads monthly including fixed asset register and inventory management.

·        Manage the annual audits in a timely manner and in line with group reporting requirements.

·        Partner with site Management Teams to drive and deliver the Annual Plan and forecasts.

·        Manage the compliance with taxation requirements, including but not limited to VAT, CT, C&E, Intrastat CRO & CSO filings.

·        Manage and process payroll for the site including related benefits.

·        Manage the company insurance policies and annual renewals.

·        Work with the R&D team to complete grant submissions for review by external bodies.

·        Developing and setting the standard cost for all products and regularly reviewing BOMs, including labour and overhead costs.

·        Monitor the product margin on customer shipments and report any variances to the commercial team.

 

QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, EXPERIENCE:

·        5 years or more previous relevant experience within a manufacturing or FMCG environment.

·        Experience of standard costing, calculating profitability by customer and manufacturing variance analysis.

·        ACA/ACCA/CIMA/CPA Qualified Accountant.

·        QAD/MFG PRO experience desirable but not essential.

 

PERSON SPECIFICATION AND CORE COMPETENCIES:

·        Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with good leadership abilities.

·        High level of self-motivation.

·        Honed decision making, applying pragmatism and organisational understanding to operational decisions.

·        Team player with strong work ethic.

·        Lead and coach the Finance Team, portraying honesty and integrity throughout.

·        Ability to actively identify and mitigate risk and seek out business opportunities.

·        Motivated to be a high achiever with right first time and on time standards.

·        Be a problem solver with a positive “Can-do” attitude.

·        Confident individual that accepts responsibility and accountability.

job.companydescription:
Flagship Signs are a Westmeath based signage and business branding company specialising in high quality design and delivery of all forms of promotional material from a simple professional nameplate to complex vehicle signage and advertising campaigns. Our objective is to take full and detailed instructions from which we develop into a draft design and once approved deliver creative distinctive, dynamic and effective signs and graphics for clients who value high quality design and high standards of service.

Owner / designer Stuart O’Regan, who has an Honours Degree in Fine Art & Design, meets with each customer and taking detailed instructions establishes what the customer requires. He interprets this instruction and renders it in a graphic design which is submitted to the client for approval. Only when approved the job is sent for printing or manufacture. Finally the product is delivered and where relevant fitted.

Flagship Sign Design covers all aspects of signage including design, manufacturing, fitting and maintenance. We combine the highest standards of quality and local knowledge to offer our customers a complete service. From small one-off jobs to national contracts, we are equipped to make your business branding “say it loud”.

We use the best manufacturing and fabrication techniques, ranging from traditional gold leafing to the most modern computer assisted fabrication systems. We take pride in our product and aspire to total customer satisfaction.

job.title: Product Development Manager
job.description:
DECOTEK Automotive is based in the Irish midlands employing approximately 320 people in a highly skilled manufacturing environment. We design, develop and manufacture premium exterior trim components for the global automotive industry customers.

We are currently recruiting for a Product Development Manager. This role will be full-time. Working hours will be Monday-Friday 08.00-16.30.

At Decotek Automotive the Product Development Manager will be responsible for leading the development and launch of new products from concept stage to the development of prototypes through to finished products ready for manufacture. They will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, and sales, to ensure that products are developed on time, within budget, and to the required specifications. Their role will involve applying project management skills, market research, and business acumen to drive innovation and growth. 

Principal Accountabilities:

·    Manage and oversee all project management activities to support internal and external customers

  • Contribute to the creation and implementation of best practice engineering vision, strategy, policies, processes and procedures to aid and improve operational performance.
  • Ability to capture and specify the design requirements and the development and validation needed to deliver successful components to meet/exceed the customer’s specifications.
  • Responsibility for the management of all Design activities including Request for Quotations (RFQs), Design freeze / release, Design Failure Mode Effect Analysis (DFMEA), Production Part Approval Process (PPAP), Design Verification/Product Validation (DV & PV) testing and Computer-aided engineering (CAE).
  • Present design, costs, changes and budgetary information effectively to senior stakeholders and customers, providing regular progress updates.
  • Respond to Requests for Quotation (RFQs) from the Sales department.
  • Ensure that the function operates in accordance with any health, safety and environmental policies and procedures to ensure the safety and wellbeing of staff and visitors.
  • Lead the team in new product development projects.
  • Prepare for and present status of product development work packages at project gate reviews (including corrective actions if necessary)
  • Motivate and coach the team to operational success.
  • Set department objectives/KPIs and review and assess ongoing performance of direct reports.
  • Stay current and up to date on any technology changes that may affect engineering design and development and advise others of any impact.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal performance.
  • Participate in the development and continuous improvement of departmental guidelines and procedures.
  • Ensure departmental compliance with all TS16949 requirements, policies, and PMO directives to perform other duties as assigned.

 Skills and Experience:

  • 5+ Years of Experience in the Automotive Industry
  • 3+ years of experience in Product Development
  • Relevant manufacturing/engineering degree
  • Knowledge of Decotek ideal but not essential
  • In depth knowledge and experience of DFMEA, FMEA, APQP, PPAP, and Six Sigma
  • Experience of New Product Introduction, reworking design changes and upgrades through to production
  • Ability to innovate and think independently
  • Expertise in product discovery and product design opportunities
  • Detailed understanding of the key challenges businesses face commercially and how Decotek can help existing and prospective clients overcome these
  • Effective communicator - can clearly explain and present ideas, observations and findings with excellent presentation and interpersonal skills
  • Analytical in approach to data and problem solving
  • Experience of managing a team
  • Membership of an industry related Professional Body would be advantageous

 Interested? What can Decotek offer you?

  • We provide 21.5 days of annual leave - plus your 10 statutory bank holidays
  • Compassionate Leave
  • Refer A Friend Scheme
  • Bike to Work Scheme
  • Employee Assistance Programme for you and your family, offering up to 8 free counselling sessions, and many more wellness benefits
  • Attendance Bonus
  • Health & Safety Bonus
  • Bi-Annual Events including Summer BBQ & Xmas Dinner

 We'd love to hear from you. Please hit the link to apply, or get in touch via our careers page for more information on any of our open vacancies @ Decotek Automotive Ltd.

job.description:
Who we are?


At Mergon, we mould ideas for a sustainable future.  We work with leading brands like Tesla, BMW, Xerox and Abbott to design, manufacture and deliver sustainable products for the vehicles and equipment of the future.

 

We care deeply about our colleagues, customers and our community and we have a curiosity that constantly pushes us to innovate and improve.  We are competent, capable and we invest in our people and in our processes to ensure we continue to grow and do our best work every day. 

What’s the job?

We are currently looking for a Production Chargehand  (Assistant Supervisor) to work in production and lead a team of Production Operators. This position is a full time, permanent position on a 4-cycle shift pattern.  Reporting to the Operations Lead, duties of the Charge Hand will include:

 

Role responsibilities:

  • Create a culture of safety first by supervising adherence to safety procedures.
  • Plan and communicate the daily production workload in conjunction with the Operations Lead, delegating duties to relevant people.
  • Ensure all production related information is maintained in the ERP system.
  • Troubleshoot on blow moulding and injection moulding machine processes as required.
  • Motivate, encourage and give feedback to the team and resolve any concerns /roadblocks to achieving targets.
  • Develop team skills to ensure operators are trained appropriately.
  • Liaise with engineers and other departments to ensure smooth running of production, resolve issues and reduce downtime.
  • Ensure housekeeping standards are maintained to the highest standard.
  • Feedback and report production and machine metrics and relevant issues to the Operations Lead.
  • Assume responsibility for overall management of the shift in absence of Operations Lead. 

 

 

To be successful in this role:

  • Previous experience in a manufacturing/production environment
  • Ideally previous experience running a team of operators
  • Strong organisation skills, and the ability to prioritise and meet deadlines
  • Be able to work on own initiative
  • Ability to learn new tasks quickly and take on a wide range of responsibilities
  • Excellent communication skills including the ability to brief/debrief a team
  • Ability to foster good working relationships within and across teams

Benefits:

·        Competitive Salary

·        26 days holidays

·        Career Growth and Development Opportunities

·        Company Gym

·        Wellness Programme

·        Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)

Mergon is an Irish owned company with operations in Ireland,  Czech Republic, U.K., Mexico and USA.

Established in 1981 Mergon works with leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors.

It's Irish operations are based in Castlepollard in the heart of the Irish Midlands close to Mullingar. Mergon are an excellent employer in the midlands and have been very supportive of the local community over the years. Mergon have been involved in excellent health and education initiatives such as International Men’s Day, LEGO DAY , Science Week  and Mergon's School Engineering Experience. 

Mergon works with its customers to design, manufacture and assemble components that make their products succeed in their chosen markets.

In recent years the company has increased its capabilities in additive manufacturing and systems manufacturing; supplying complex moulded and electronics based assemblies to major clients like Abbott and Xerox.

As a result of working across many different sectors, Mergon has access to and experience in best practice from leaders in the Automotive, Industrial and Healthcare sectors. We believe this wealth of cross industrial experience makes us a valuable partner and gives our customers insights to ideas that typical suppliers may not have.

 

As a responsible plastic products manufacturer, Mergon constantly works to ensure that its impact on the environment meets or exceeds the expectations of both customers and the community.

Through the effective implementation of reduction, re-use and re-cycling policies and to underline our pro-active approach, Mergon was the first Technical Blow Molding company in the world to receive accreditation to the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, which provides a framework for cost-effective and environmentally sensitive manufacturing.
